intro: Erigeron latisquamus var. bornmuelleri, commonly known as the Narrowleaf Fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many familiar flowering plants. This variety is often found in dry, sunny environments and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
